result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
ADDRESS INFO for Tyler J. Reepsdorf
Current: N9252 State Rd 73, Neshkoro, WI 54960 United States  (Effective: 01-27-2016)
Prior: W2726 Marion St., Neshkoro, WI 54960

Defendant Tyler J. Reepsdorf in court with attorney Mark Jay Gumz.  Defendant Tyler J. Reepsdorf in custody.  Chad A. Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin. D.A. plea hearing to all 3 cases 15 CM 29 & 30 also. Count 1 15 CF 11 felony theft; no contest 1 & 2 15 CM 30. Dismiss count 2 in 15 CF 11 as well as dismiss & read in balance of charges15 CM 30 & 15 CM 29 Count 2 15 CF 11 dismiss & read in. DPA 24 mo - Treatment Court condition on DPA. Treatment plea agreement change case number to 15 CF 11 & 15 CM 30 counts 1 & 2. 15 CM 30- withhold sent 24 mo prob.- 60 days jail on count 1 stayed for use in treatment court- $243.00 ea count; restitution $1445.00 15 CF 11 & $572.47 in 15 CM 30. 10% rest. surcharge. Atty Gumz agrees and agrees with restitution amount.  Defendant entered No contest plea. Court questions defendant regarding plea. Advises of Constitutional Rights and elements of the charge.  Court finds plea made knowingly, voluntarily & Intelligently.  Court relies on the criminal complaint for a factual basis.  BY THE COURT:  Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charges.  Court accepts defendant's plea and finds defendant guilty.
Court: 15 CF 11 Court approves DPA 24 mo.w/Treatment Court condition; 15 CM 30 Counts 1 & 2 withhold sentence 24 mo probation. 60 days jail on Count 1, stay for use in treat Ct; $243.00 each count; treatment & counseling as recommended. Restitution as requested in both cases as probation condition. 101 sentence credit only apply if DPA is terminated or probation revoked. Report to Ms Runge for bracelet. 24 hrs to report to 
Dismiss & read in: count 2 in 15 CF 11; 15 CM 29 & balance of 15 CM 30
D.A. in custody -101 sentence credit if sentenced on 15 CF 11; victim impact statements provided to Court. Defendant will be released today. Need to report to Sheila Runge. Atty Gumz had contact with victims.  Status conference scheduled for June 18, 2015 at 01:00 pm.
Return date on April 1, 2015 at 10:00 am.

Defendant Tyler J. Reepsdorf by video, in custody.  Chad A. Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Defendant received a copy of the criminal complaint.  Court advises defendant of right to an attorney.  Atty Hendee requests $500 cash bond to be applied to both this case and 15CF11.  Defendant requests signature bond.
BY THE COURT:  Court sets $500 cash bond (entered and printed in 15CF11).  Set return date to track with 15CF11.  Return date scheduled for April 1, 2015 at 10:00 am.
